signature.pp: (X Y : Type) : Prop

ref.pp:
/-- The definition of equal cardinality. For simplicity we restrict attention to the Type 0 universe.
This is analogous to `Chapter3.SetTheory.Set.EqualCard`, but we are not using the latter since
the Chapter 3 set theory is deprecated. -/
abbrev EqualCard (X Y : Type) : Prop :=
  ∃ f : X → Y, Function.Bijective f

signature.pp: {X Y : Type} : EqualCard X Y ↔ Nonempty (X ≃ Y)

ref.pp:
/-- Relation with Mathlib's `Equiv` concept -/
theorem iff {X Y : Type} : EqualCard X Y ↔ Nonempty (X ≃ Y) :=
  by
  simp [EqualCard]; constructor
  . intro ⟨f, hf⟩; exact ⟨.ofBijective f hf⟩
  intro ⟨e⟩; exact ⟨e.toFun, e.bijective⟩

signature.pp: {X Y : Type} : EqualCard X Y ↔ Cardinal.mk X = Cardinal.mk Y

ref.pp:
/-- Equivalence with Mathlib's `Cardinal.mk` concept -/
theorem iff' {X Y : Type} : EqualCard X Y ↔ Cardinal.mk X = Cardinal.mk Y := by simp [Cardinal.eq, iff]

signature.pp: (X : Type) : EqualCard X X

ref.pp:
theorem refl (X : Type) : EqualCard X X :=
  sorry

signature.pp: {X Y : Type} (hXY : EqualCard X Y) : EqualCard Y X

ref.pp: theorem symm {X Y : Type} (hXY : EqualCard X Y) : EqualCard Y X := by sorry

signature.pp: {X Y Z : Type} (hXY : EqualCard X Y) (hYZ : EqualCard Y Z) : EqualCard X Z

ref.pp: theorem trans {X Y Z : Type} (hXY : EqualCard X Y) (hYZ : EqualCard Y Z) : EqualCard X Z := by sorry

signature.pp: : Setoid Type

ref.pp:
instance instSetoid : Setoid Type :=
  ⟨EqualCard, ⟨refl, symm, trans⟩⟩

signature.pp: (X : Type) : EqualCard (.univ : Set X) X

ref.pp:
theorem univ (X : Type) : EqualCard (.univ : Set X) X :=
  ⟨Subtype.val, Subtype.val_injective, by intro _; aesop⟩

signature.pp: (X : Type) : Prop

ref.pp:
abbrev CountablyInfinite (X : Type) : Prop :=
  EqualCard X ℕ

signature.pp: (X : Type) : Prop

ref.pp:
abbrev AtMostCountable (X : Type) : Prop :=
  CountablyInfinite X ∨ Finite X

signature.pp: {X Y : Type} (hXY : EqualCard X Y) : CountablyInfinite X ↔ CountablyInfinite Y

ref.pp:
theorem equiv {X Y : Type} (hXY : EqualCard X Y) : CountablyInfinite X ↔ CountablyInfinite Y :=
  ⟨hXY.symm.trans, hXY.trans⟩

signature.pp: {X Y : Type} (hXY : EqualCard X Y) : Finite X ↔ Finite Y

ref.pp:
theorem equiv {X Y : Type} (hXY : EqualCard X Y) : Finite X ↔ Finite Y := by obtain ⟨f, hf⟩ := hXY;
  exact (Equiv.ofBijective f hf).finite_iff

signature.pp: {X Y : Type} (hXY : EqualCard X Y) : AtMostCountable X ↔ AtMostCountable Y

ref.pp:
theorem equiv {X Y : Type} (hXY : EqualCard X Y) : AtMostCountable X ↔ AtMostCountable Y := by
  simp [AtMostCountable, CountablyInfinite.equiv hXY, Finite.equiv hXY]

signature.pp: (X : Type) : CountablyInfinite X ↔ Nonempty (Denumerable X)

ref.pp:
/-- Equivalence with Mathlib's `Denumerable` concept (cf. Remark 8.1.2) -/
theorem iff (X : Type) : CountablyInfinite X ↔ Nonempty (Denumerable X) :=
  by
  simp [CountablyInfinite, EqualCard.iff]; constructor
  . intro ⟨e⟩; exact ⟨Denumerable.mk' e⟩
  intro ⟨h⟩; exact ⟨h.eqv X⟩

signature.pp: (X : Type) : CountablyInfinite X ↔ Countable X ∧ Infinite X

ref.pp:
/-- Equivalence with Mathlib's `Countable` typeclass -/
theorem iff' (X : Type) : CountablyInfinite X ↔ Countable X ∧ Infinite X := by rw [iff, nonempty_denumerable_iff]

signature.pp: {X : Type} (hX : CountablyInfinite X) : Countable X

ref.pp: theorem toCountable {X : Type} (hX : CountablyInfinite X) : Countable X := by simp_all [iff']

signature.pp: {X : Type} (hX : CountablyInfinite X) : Infinite X

ref.pp: theorem toInfinite {X : Type} (hX : CountablyInfinite X) : Infinite X := by simp_all [iff']

signature.pp: (X : Type) : AtMostCountable X ↔ Countable X

ref.pp:
theorem iff (X : Type) : AtMostCountable X ↔ Countable X :=
  by
  observe h1 : CountablyInfinite X ↔ Countable X ∧ Infinite X
  observe h2 : Finite X ∨ Infinite X
  observe h3 : Finite X → Countable X
  tauto

signature.pp: {A : Type} (X : Set A) : CountablyInfinite X ↔ ∃ f : ℕ ↪ A, X = f '' .univ

ref.pp:
theorem iff_image_inj {A : Type} (X : Set A) : CountablyInfinite X ↔ ∃ f : ℕ ↪ A, X = f '' .univ :=
  by
  constructor
  . intro ⟨g, hg⟩
    choose f hleft hright using Function.bijective_iff_has_inverse.mp hg
    refine ⟨⟨Subtype.val ∘ f, ?_⟩, ?_⟩
    . intro x y hxy; apply hright.injective; simp_all [Subtype.val_inj]
    ext; simp; constructor
    . intro hx; use g ⟨_, hx⟩; simp [hleft _]
    rintro ⟨_, rfl⟩; aesop
  intro ⟨f, hf⟩
  have := Function.leftInverse_invFun (Function.Embedding.injective f)
  use (Function.invFun f) ∘ Subtype.val; split_ands
  . rintro ⟨x, hx⟩ ⟨y, hy⟩ h; grind
  intro n; use ⟨f n, by aesop⟩; grind

theorem exists_unique_min {X : Set ℕ} (hX : X.Nonempty) : ∃! m ∈ X, ∀ n ∈ X, m ≤ n := by sorry

signature.pp: (X : Set ℕ) : ℕ

ref.pp:
noncomputable abbrev min (X : Set ℕ) : ℕ :=
  if hX : X.Nonempty then (exists_unique_min hX).exists.choose else 0

signature.pp: {X : Set ℕ} (hX : X.Nonempty) : min X ∈ X ∧ ∀ n ∈ X, min X ≤ n

ref.pp:
theorem min_spec {X : Set ℕ} (hX : X.Nonempty) : min X ∈ X ∧ ∀ n ∈ X, min X ≤ n := by simp [hX, min];
  exact (exists_unique_min hX).exists.choose_spec

signature.pp: {X : Set ℕ} (hX : X.Nonempty) {a : ℕ} (ha : a ∈ X ∧ ∀ n ∈ X, a ≤ n) : min X = a

ref.pp:
theorem min_eq {X : Set ℕ} (hX : X.Nonempty) {a : ℕ} (ha : a ∈ X ∧ ∀ n ∈ X, a ≤ n) : min X = a :=
  (exists_unique_min hX).unique (min_spec hX) ha

theorem min_empty : min ∅ = 0 := by simp [Nat.min]

(X : Set ℕ) [Infinite X] : ∃! f : ℕ → X, Function.Bijective f ∧ StrictMono f

ref.pp:
/-- Proposition 8.1.5 -/
theorem monotone_enum_of_infinite (X : Set ℕ) [Infinite X] : ∃! f : ℕ → X, Function.Bijective f ∧ StrictMono f := by
  -- This proof is written to follow the structure of the original text.
  
  let a : ℕ → ℕ := Nat.strongRec (fun n a ↦ min ({x ∈ X | ∀ (m : ℕ) (h : m < n), x ≠ a m h}))
  have ha : ∀ n, a n = min ({x ∈ X | ∀ (m : ℕ) (h : m < n), x ≠ a m}) := Nat.strongRec.eq_def _
  have ha_infinite (n : ℕ) : Infinite ({x ∈ X | ∀ (m : ℕ) (h : m < n), x ≠ a m}) := by sorry
  have ha_nonempty (n : ℕ) : {x ∈ X | ∀ (m : ℕ) (h : m < n), x ≠ a m}.Nonempty := Set.Nonempty.of_subtype
  have ha_mono : StrictMono a := by sorry
  have ha_injective : Function.Injective a := by sorry
  have haX (n : ℕ) : a n ∈ X := by sorry
  set f : ℕ → X := fun n ↦ ⟨a n, haX n⟩
  have hf_injective : Function.Injective f := by intro x y hxy; simp [f] at hxy; solve_by_elim
  have hf_surjective : Function.Surjective f := by
    intro ⟨x, hx⟩; simp [f]; by_contra
    have h1 (n : ℕ) : x ∈ {x ∈ X | ∀ (m : ℕ) (h : m < n), x ≠ a m} := by sorry
    have h2 (n : ℕ) : x ≥ a n := by rw [ha n]; exact ge_iff_le.mpr ((min_spec (ha_nonempty n)).2 _ (h1 n))
    have h3 (n : ℕ) : a n ≥ n := by sorry
    have h4 (n : ℕ) : x ≥ n := (h3 n).trans (h2 n)
    linarith [h4 (x + 1)]
  apply ExistsUnique.intro _ ⟨⟨hf_injective, hf_surjective⟩, ha_mono⟩
  intro g ⟨hg_bijective, hg_mono⟩; by_contra!
  replace : {n | g n ≠ f n}.Nonempty := by
    contrapose! this
    apply funext; simpa [Set.eq_empty_iff_forall_notMem] using this
  set m := min {n | g n ≠ f n}
  have hm : g m ≠ f m := (min_spec this).1
  have hm' {n : ℕ} (hn : n < m) : g n = f n := by by_contra hgfn; linarith [(min_spec this).2 n (by simp [hgfn])]
  have hgm : g m = min ({x ∈ X | ∀ (n : ℕ) (h : n < m), x ≠ a n}) := by sorry
  rw [← ha m] at hgm; contrapose! hm; exact Subtype.val_injective hgm

signature.pp: (X : Set ℕ) [Infinite X] : CountablyInfinite X

ref.pp:
theorem countable_of_infinite (X : Set ℕ) [Infinite X] : CountablyInfinite X :=
  by
  have := (monotone_enum_of_infinite X).exists
  exact EqualCard.symm ⟨this.choose, this.choose_spec.1⟩

signature.pp: (X : Set ℕ) : AtMostCountable X

ref.pp:
/-- Corollary 8.1.6 -/
theorem atMostCountable_subset (X : Set ℕ) : AtMostCountable X :=
  by
  obtain _ | _ := finite_or_infinite X
  . tauto
  simp [AtMostCountable, countable_of_infinite]

signature.pp: {X : Type} (hX : AtMostCountable X) (Y : Set X) : AtMostCountable Y

ref.pp:
/-- Corollary 8.1.7 -/
theorem subset {X : Type} (hX : AtMostCountable X) (Y : Set X) : AtMostCountable Y := by
  -- This proof is written to follow the structure of the original text.
  
  obtain ⟨f, hf⟩ | hX := hX
  . let f' : Y → f '' Y := fun y ↦ ⟨f y, by aesop⟩
    have hf' : Function.Bijective f' := by sorry
    rw [equiv ⟨_, hf'⟩]; apply Nat.atMostCountable_subset
  simp [AtMostCountable, show Finite Y by infer_instance]

signature.pp: {A : Type} {X Y : Set A} (hX : AtMostCountable X) (hY : Y ⊆ X) : AtMostCountable Y

ref.pp:
theorem subset' {A : Type} {X Y : Set A} (hX : AtMostCountable X) (hY : Y ⊆ X) : AtMostCountable Y :=
  by
  refine' (equiv ⟨fun y ↦ ⟨↑↑y, y.property⟩, _, _⟩).mp (subset hX {x : X | ↑x ∈ Y})
  . intro ⟨⟨_, _⟩, _⟩ ⟨⟨_, _⟩, _⟩ _; simp_all
  intro ⟨y, hy⟩; use ⟨⟨y, hY hy⟩, by aesop⟩

theorem union {A : Type} {X Y : Set A} (hX : CountablyInfinite X) (hY : CountablyInfinite Y) :

signature.pp: : CountablyInfinite ℤ

ref.pp:
/-- Corollary 8.1.11 --/
theorem countablyInfinite : CountablyInfinite ℤ := by
  -- This proof is written to follow the structure of the original text.
  
  have h1 : CountablyInfinite {n : ℤ | n ≥ 0} :=
    by
    rw [CountablyInfinite.iff_image_inj]
    use ⟨(↑· : ℕ → ℤ), by intro _ _ _; simp_all⟩
    ext n; simp; refine ⟨?_, by aesop⟩
    . intro h; use n.toNat; simp [h]
  have h2 : CountablyInfinite {n : ℤ | n ≤ 0} :=
    by
    rw [CountablyInfinite.iff_image_inj]
    use ⟨(-↑· : ℕ → ℤ), by intro _ _ _; simp_all⟩
    ext n; simp; refine ⟨?_, by aesop⟩
    intro h; use (-n).toNat; simp [h]
  have : CountablyInfinite (.univ : Set ℤ) := by convert h1.union h2; ext; simp; omega
  rwa [← CountablyInfinite.equiv (.univ _)]

signature.pp: : CountablyInfinite {n : ℕ × ℕ | n.2 ≤ n.1}

ref.pp:
/-- Lemma 8.1.12 -/
theorem lower_diag : CountablyInfinite {n : ℕ × ℕ | n.2 ≤ n.1} := by
  -- This proof is written to follow the structure of the original text.
  
  let A := {n : ℕ × ℕ | n.2 ≤ n.1}
  let a : ℕ → ℕ := fun n ↦ ∑ m ∈ .range (n + 1), m
  have ha : StrictMono a := by sorry
  let f : A → ℕ := fun ⟨(n, m), _⟩ ↦ a n + m
  have hf : Function.Injective f := by
    rintro ⟨⟨n, m⟩, hnm⟩ ⟨⟨n', m'⟩, hnm'⟩ h
    simp [A, f] at hnm hnm' ⊢ h
    obtain hnn' | rfl | hnn' := lt_trichotomy n n'
    . have : a n' + m' > a n + m := by
        calc
          _ ≥ a n' := by linarith
          _ ≥ a (n + 1) := (ha.monotone (by linarith))
          _ = a n + (n + 1) := (Finset.sum_range_succ id _)
          _ > a n + m := by linarith
      linarith
    . simpa using h
    have : a n + m > a n' + m' := by
      calc
        _ ≥ a n := by linarith
        _ ≥ a (n' + 1) := (ha.monotone (by linarith))
        _ = a n' + (n' + 1) := (Finset.sum_range_succ id _)
        _ > a n' + m' := by linarith
    linarith
  let f' : A → f '' .univ := fun p ↦ ⟨f p, by aesop⟩
  have hf' : Function.Bijective f' := by
    constructor
    . intro p q hpq; simp [f'] at hpq; solve_by_elim
    intro ⟨l, hl⟩; simp at hl
    obtain ⟨n, m, q, rfl⟩ := hl; use ⟨(n, m), q⟩
  have : AtMostCountable A := by rw [AtMostCountable.equiv ⟨_, hf'⟩]; apply Nat.atMostCountable_subset
  have hfin : ¬Finite A := by sorry
  simp [AtMostCountable] at this; tauto

signature.pp: : CountablyInfinite (ℕ × ℕ)

ref.pp:
/-- Corollary 8.1.13 -/
theorem prod_nat : CountablyInfinite (ℕ × ℕ) :=
  by
  have upper_diag : CountablyInfinite {n : ℕ × ℕ | n.1 ≤ n.2} :=
    by
    refine (equiv ⟨fun ⟨(n, m), _⟩ ↦ ⟨(m, n), by aesop⟩, ?_, ?_⟩).mp lower_diag
    . intro ⟨(_, _), _⟩ ⟨(_, _), _⟩ _; aesop
    intro ⟨(n, m), _⟩; use ⟨(m, n), by aesop⟩
  have : CountablyInfinite (.univ : Set (ℕ × ℕ)) := by convert union lower_diag upper_diag; ext ⟨n, m⟩; simp; omega
  exact (equiv (.univ _)).mp this

signature.pp: : CountablyInfinite ℚ

ref.pp:
/-- Corollary 8.1.15 -/
theorem countablyInfinite : CountablyInfinite ℚ := by
  -- This proof is written to follow the structure of the original text.
  
  have : CountablyInfinite {n : ℤ | n ≠ 0} := by sorry
  apply Int.countablyInfinite.prod at this
  let f : ℤ × {n : ℤ | n ≠ 0} → ℚ := fun (a, b) ↦ (a / b : ℚ)
  replace := AtMostCountable.image this f
  have h : f '' .univ = .univ := by sorry
  simp [h, AtMostCountable.equiv (EqualCard.univ _), AtMostCountable] at this
  have hfin : ¬Finite ℚ := by
    by_contra!
    replace : Finite (.univ : Set ℕ) := by apply @Finite.Set.finite_of_finite_image ℕ ℚ _ (↑·); intro _ _ _ _; simp
    rw [Set.finite_coe_iff, Set.finite_univ_iff, ← not_infinite_iff_finite] at this
    apply this; infer_instance
  tauto
